newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks soften in early morning trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks soften in early morning trade.

text.p: Tokyo stock prices softened slightly in early Wednesday morning trade.

But brokers said most participants were sitting on the fence, waiting for the annoucement of the Bank of Japan's closely watched quarterly "tankan" survey of corporate sentiment scheduled for 11 a.m. (0200 GMT) today.
"The Nikkei average is likely to be range-bound, led by its futures, because there are not many factors to prompt buying or selling," a Mito Securities deputy general manager said.
At 0015 GMT, the benchmark Nikkei 225 average stood at 20,884.24, down 26.03 points or 0.12 percent. Its September futures were also down, shedding 10 points to 20,940.
